body_content.explanation: a trained volunteer (= a person who does something willingly and without being paid) who helps the ambulance service (= the special vehicles and people that go to deal with medical emergencies) by going quickly to an emergency and giving medical help:
examples: As a community first responder (CFR), you'll provide emergency treatment to people in your local area.
Community First Responders are trained to use defibrillators and respond to life-threatening emergency calls in their area.
